p: Considerations of the emergences of infectious diseases begin with the infectious agent itself. Although many established diseases, such as tuberculosis, malaria, and cholera, are bacterial or protozoal, and yet others are caused by fungi (e.g ., cryptococci) or agents such as Rickettsia or prions, the majority of important newly emerging and re-emerging diseases in the past century have been viral. This review therefore emphasizes viruses, including SARS-CoV, and SARS-CoV-2, influenza, arboviruses, and hemorrhagic fever viruses among others.
